intro: Kunzea pulchella, commonly known as the pink kunzea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, pink or white flowers that bloom in dense clusters. Its leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and covered in a fine, silvery-white bloom. Kunzea pulchella is often found in heathlands and dry forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
